history.content: Summarize the stages of the tasks we want to accomplish

Dr. Juan B. Gutiérrez, here is a concise overview of the stages we aim to accomplish:

1. Data Acquisition and QC  
   • Gather transcriptomics, metabolomics, proteomics, and clinical data.  
   • Perform basic quality checks and normalization (e.g., filtering genes, handling missing metabolite data, median-normalizing proteomics signals).

2. Cross-Species Harmonization  
   • Use Ensembl BioMart to map one-to-one gene orthologs between Macaca mulatta and Macaca fascicularis.  
   • Exclude any genes without direct one-to-one orthologs or with complex mappings.

3. Multi-Omic Integration  
   • Integrate transcriptomic, metabolomic, proteomic, and clinical information.  
   • Apply multivariate methods (DIABLO or pairwise PLS) to identify key signals that distinguish susceptible vs resilient host responses.

4. Pathway and Phase-Stratified Interpretation  
   • Examine functional pathways (e.g., KEGG, Reactome) and identify influences of different infection phases.  
   • Correlate identified modules with parasitemia and hematological measures.

5. Visualization and Reporting  
   • Produce QC plots, differential expression plots (volcano, PCA), heatmaps, and network diagrams.  
   • Provide a thorough written report, metadata files, and reproducible code/scripts.
I want to start stage 1. Give me the links to all data files that I need to accomplish my task, and their description

Dr. Juan B. Gutiérrez, below is a consolidated list of the data sources (with links) you will need for Stage 1 (Data Acquisition and QC). These include transcripts (RNA-Seq), metabolomics, proteomics (SOMAScan), and clinical files for Experiments 06 and 07, plus a brief description of each.

━━━━━━━━━━━━━
EXPERIMENT 06 (E06 – Macaca mulatta)
━━━━━━━━━━━━━
1) Clinical Data  
   • URL: http://plasmodb.org/common/downloads/MaHPIC/Experiment_06/  
   • Description: Contains CSV, XLS, or TSV files for parasitemia (microscopy, PCR), hematology, reticulocyte counts, and other clinical/telemetry measurements collected daily or other specific time intervals during infection.

2) Transcriptomics (GSE127079)  
   • GEO Accession: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/query/acc.cgi?acc=GSE127079  
   • Description: RNA-Seq data of E06 (whole blood and/or bone marrow) at multiple timepoints post-inoculation. Includes raw count data, metadata, and protocols.

3) Metabolomics (MTBLS824)  
   • MetaboLights Accession: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/metabolights/MTBLS824  
   • Description: Untargeted metabolomics data gathered from plasma and cellular fractions. Contains peak tables, sample metadata, and experimental details.

4) Proteomics (SOMAScan)  
   • URL: http://plasmodb.org/common/downloads/MaHPIC/Experiment_06/E06TargetedProteomics-Feb2019/  
   • Description: Targeted proteomic quantifications generated via SOMAScan assays. Provides normalized intensities (or raw intensities plus metadata).

5) Telemetry (Optional)  
   • URL: Same directory as E06 Clinical Data above.  
   • Description: May include continuous remote measurements for body temperature, heart rate, activity, etc. Not strictly required unless you plan time-series correlations with physiologic measures.


━━━━━━━━━━━━━
EXPERIMENT 07 (E07 – Macaca fascicularis, with one M. mulatta control)
━━━━━━━━━━━━━
1) Clinical Data (E07A)  
   • URL: http://plasmodb.org/common/downloads/MaHPIC/Experiment_07/E07AMalariaCore/  
   • Description: Data from a failed inoculation trial. Generally treated as exploratory; use if you wish to evaluate baseline or out-of-range behaviors.

2) Clinical Data (E07B)  
   • URL: http://plasmodb.org/common/downloads/MaHPIC/Experiment_07/E07BMalariaCore/  
   • Description: Main clinical dataset for E07B, which successfully infected Macaca fascicularis (and included a M. mulatta control). Contains parasitemia, hematology, reticulocytes, etc.

3) Transcriptomics (GSE128115)  
   • GEO Accession: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/query/acc.cgi?acc=GSE128115  
   • Description: RNA-Seq data (whole blood and/or bone marrow) for E07. Similar structure to GSE127079, with raw counts and metadata across six timepoints.

4) Metabolomics (MTBLS822)  
   • MetaboLights Accession: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/metabolights/MTBLS822  
   • Description: Metabolomics data for E07, using similar methodology as E06. Includes peak listings, QC, and associated sample metadata.

5) Proteomics (SOMAScan)  
   • URL: http://plasmodb.org/common/downloads/MaHPIC/Experiment_07/E07TargetedProteomics-Feb2019/  
   • Description: SOMAScan-based proteomic quantifications for E07. Check presence of readme files for sample naming schemes, normalization details, etc.

6) Telemetry (Optional)  
   • URL: Same directory (E07) as the clinical data.  
   • Description: Continuous measures of physiology similar to E06, used for time-series correlation with infection phases or daily averages.


━━━━━━━━━━━━━
HOW TO USE THESE RESOURCES
━━━━━━━━━━━━━
• Clinical directories (for E06, E07A, E07B) are hosted at http://plasmodb.org under “MaHPIC” and typically include spreadsheets with daily parasitemia counts, reticulocyte measurements, and CBC data.  
• GEO (Gene Expression Omnibus) links (GSE127079, GSE128115) provide transcript levels, often in raw count format (e.g., FASTQ, processed read counts) plus sample annotations.  
• MetaboLights accessions contain metabolomics raw data, peak tables, and study design files.  
• Proteomics (SOMAScan) directories house spreadsheets or TSV files with protein abundance levels.  
• Telemetry is optional; you only need these data if you want to incorporate physiological time-series correlates.

By obtaining these files, you will have the complete multi-omic and clinical scope needed for Stage 1 of the pipeline (Data Acquisition and QC). Let me know if you need more details on how to organize or process these datasets.
